snippet: The Federal Reserve is expected to raise interest rates this week, but waiting until inflation rises would give the Fed more room to respond to a recession.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column contends that, in light of Federal Reserve's expected plan to raise interest rates, urgency to stifle alleged inflationary pressure appears premature; says despite interest rates hovering around zero, advanced industrial economies have struggled to increase growth; asserts that 4 percent inflation target could provide Federal Reserve with more crisis tools.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve is expected to raise interest rates this week, but waiting until inflation rises would give the Fed more room to respond to a recession.

headline.print_headline: We Could Handle a Bit More Inflation
headline.main: Preparing to Raise Rates, Fed Underestimates Benefits of More Inflation
